intro: Eleogiton planifolia, commonly known as the flat-leaf eleogiton, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its broad, flat leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in tropical and subtropical environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a landscape plant.
